input.content:
# JetBrains Academy Catalog Scraping Report

**Date**: 2026-02-05
**URL**: https://www.jetbrains.com/academy/ (redirects to https://academy.jetbrains.com/)
**Total Courses**: 29

## Executive Summary

JetBrains Academy offers a curated catalog of 29 programming courses focused on in-IDE learning experiences. The platform emphasizes hands-on, practical learning directly within professional development environments (PyCharm, IntelliJ IDEA, RustRover, etc.).

**Key Findings:**
- All courses are **free** to access
- Primary focus on **programming languages** (Kotlin, Python, Rust, JavaScript, C++, Java, Scala, Go)
- Mix of beginner-friendly and advanced content
- Unique "In-IDE Learning" format differentiates from traditional online courses
- Limited duration metadata (only 17% of courses specify time commitment)

## Architecture

**Type**: Navigation-based catalog with React Server Components
**Data Source**: Server-rendered HTML with course URLs embedded in page
**Obstacles**: JavaScript-heavy rendering, no exposed API endpoints
**Solution**: Two-phase scraping:
1. Extract course URLs from catalog page (29 courses found)
2. Visit each individual course page to collect detailed metadata

## Extraction Method

### Phase 1: URL Discovery
- Accessed full catalog page: `https://academy.jetbrains.com/?tag=Full+catalog`
- Extracted all course URLs using regex pattern matching
- Found 29 unique course URLs

### Phase 2: Individual Page Scraping
- Visited each course page individually
- Extracted metadata from:
  - Page titles (H1/H2 elements)
  - Meta description tags
  - Page content (for level, duration, category inference)
- Applied 1.5-second delay between requests for respectful scraping

### Challenges Encountered
- React Server Components don't include traditional `__NEXT_DATA__` JSON
- No API endpoints exposed
- Minimal structured data on catalog page
- Required individual page visits for complete metadata

## Data Quality

| Field | Completeness | Notes |
|-------|-------------|-------|
| **Title** | 97% | 28/29 courses (avg length: 31 chars) ✓ |
| **Description** | 100% | 29/29 unique descriptions ✓ |
| **URL** | 100% | All courses have valid URLs ✓ |
| **Level** | 90% | 26/29 courses (10 Beginner, 16 Advanced) |
| **Category** | 69% | 20/29 inferred from title/URL |
| **Duration** | 17% | 5/29 courses specify time commitment |
| **Price** | 100% | All courses are Free |
| **Format** | 100% | All are "In-IDE Learning" |

**Title Quality**: ✓ Excellent (avg 31 characters, no titles >150 chars)
**Description Quality**: ✓ Excellent (100% unique, course-specific descriptions)

### Level Distribution
- **Beginner**: 10 courses (34%)
- **Advanced**: 16 courses (55%)
- **Not specified**: 3 courses (11%)

### Category Breakdown
- **Kotlin**: 9 courses (31%)
- **Python**: 5 courses (17%)
- **Rust**: 2 courses (7%)
- **JavaScript**: 2 courses (7%)
- **C++**: 1 course (3%)
- **Java**: 1 course (3%)
- **Other/Not specified**: 9 courses (31%)

### Price & Format
- **100% Free**: All courses are free to access
- **In-IDE Learning**: All courses use JetBrains' integrated development environment approach

## Limitations

1. **Duration Data Sparse**: Only 5 courses (17%) include explicit duration information
   - Most courses don't specify hours, modules, or time commitment
   - Makes it difficult to assess time investment required

2. **Category Inference**: Categories were inferred from course titles and URLs
   - 31% of courses lack clear categorization
   - May benefit from additional metadata extraction

3. **No Instructor Information**: Individual instructors not identified
   - Content appears to be produced by JetBrains Academy team
   - Some courses adapted from external sources (e.g., Rustlings, Go Tour)

4. **Limited Learning Objectives**: Course pages don't consistently provide structured learning objectives or prerequisites

5. **Incomplete Catalog**: The catalog may not represent all available content
   - Marketing materials mention "130+ courses"
   - Our scrape found 29 courses on the public catalog
   - May include additional content behind authentication or in different sections

## Recommendations

### For Data Collection
1. **Authenticate and re-scrape**: Create JetBrains account to access potential member-only courses
2. **Check Hyperskill platform**: JetBrains Academy references "Hyperskill" as a source—may have additional courses
3. **Extract duration systematically**: Develop better parsing for course length indicators
4. **Capture prerequisites**: Look for prerequisite information on individual course pages

### LinkedIn Learning Licensing Perspective

**Strengths:**
- ✅ **Unique value proposition**: In-IDE learning is distinctive and valuable for developer education
- ✅ **High-quality content**: Strong focus on modern languages (Kotlin, Rust) and practical skills
- ✅ **Professional tooling**: Integration with industry-standard IDEs (PyCharm, IntelliJ, etc.)
- ✅ **Free content**: All courses currently free, suggesting potential licensing opportunity

**Considerations:**
- ⚠️ **Technical requirements**: In-IDE format may require special integration/compatibility
- ⚠️ **Smaller catalog**: 29 courses is modest compared to other providers
- ⚠️ **Developer-focused**: Very narrow audience (software developers only)
- ⚠️ **Competing platform**: JetBrains Academy is both partner and competitor

**Recommendation**:
**Explore partnership for specialized developer content**. JetBrains Academy's unique in-IDE format and focus on modern programming languages (Kotlin, Rust) fills a gap in traditional video-based learning. Consider licensing as **supplementary technical content** rather than core catalog. Priority: **Medium**.

## Sample Courses

**Date**: 2026-02-05
**URL**: https://www.jetbrains.com/academy/ (redirects to https://academy.jetbrains.com/)
**Total Courses**: 29

## Executive Summary

JetBrains Academy offers a curated catalog of 29 programming courses focused on in-IDE learning experiences. The platform emphasizes hands-on, practical learning directly within professional development environments (PyCharm, IntelliJ IDEA, RustRover, etc.).

**Key Findings:**
- All courses are **free** to access
- Primary focus on **programming languages** (Kotlin, Python, Rust, JavaScript, C++, Java, Scala, Go)
- Mix of beginner-friendly and advanced content
- Unique "In-IDE Learning" format differentiates from traditional online courses
- Limited duration metadata (only 17% of courses specify time commitment)

## Architecture

**Type**: Navigation-based catalog with React Server Components
**Data Source**: Server-rendered HTML with course URLs embedded in page
**Obstacles**: JavaScript-heavy rendering, no exposed API endpoints
**Solution**: Two-phase scraping:
1. Extract course URLs from catalog page (29 courses found)
2. Visit each individual course page to collect detailed metadata

## Extraction Method

### Phase 1: URL Discovery
- Accessed full catalog page: `https://academy.jetbrains.com/?tag=Full+catalog`
- Extracted all course URLs using regex pattern matching
- Found 29 unique course URLs

### Phase 2: Individual Page Scraping
- Visited each course page individually
- Extracted metadata from:
  - Page titles (H1/H2 elements)
  - Meta description tags
  - Page content (for level, duration, category inference)
- Applied 1.5-second delay between requests for respectful scraping

### Challenges Encountered
- React Server Components don't include traditional `__NEXT_DATA__` JSON
- No API endpoints exposed
- Minimal structured data on catalog page
- Required individual page visits for complete metadata

## Data Quality

| Field | Completeness | Notes |
|-------|-------------|-------|
| **Title** | 97% | 28/29 courses (avg length: 31 chars) ✓ |
| **Description** | 100% | 29/29 unique descriptions ✓ |
| **URL** | 100% | All courses have valid URLs ✓ |
| **Level** | 90% | 26/29 courses (10 Beginner, 16 Advanced) |
| **Category** | 69% | 20/29 inferred from title/URL |
| **Duration** | 17% | 5/29 courses specify time commitment |
| **Price** | 100% | All courses are Free |
| **Format** | 100% | All are "In-IDE Learning" |

- **Beginner**: 10 courses (34%)

- **Kotlin**: 9 courses (31%)

- **Rust**: 2 courses (7%)
- **JavaScript**: 2 courses (7%)
- **C++**: 1 course (3%)
- **Java**: 1 course (3%)
- **Other/Not specified**: 9 courses (31%)

### Price & Format
- **100% Free**: All courses are free to access
- **In-IDE Learning**: All courses use JetBrains' integrated development environment approach

## Limitations

1. **Duration Data Sparse**: Only 5 courses (17%) include explicit duration information
   - Most courses don't specify hours, modules, or time commitment
   - Makes it difficult to assess time investment required

2. **Category Inference**: Categories were inferred from course titles and URLs
   - 31% of courses lack clear categorization
   - May benefit from additional metadata extraction

3. **No Instructor Information**: Individual instructors not identified
   - Content appears to be produced by JetBrains Academy team
   - Some courses adapted from external sources (e.g., Rustlings, Go Tour)

4. **Limited Learning Objectives**: Course pages don't consistently provide structured learning objectives or prerequisites

5. **Incomplete Catalog**: The catalog may not represent all available content
   - Marketing materials mention "130+ courses"
   - Our scrape found 29 courses on the public catalog
   - May include additional content behind authentication or in different sections

## Recommendations

### For Data Collection
1. **Authenticate and re-scrape**: Create JetBrains account to access potential member-only courses
2. **Check Hyperskill platform**: JetBrains Academy references "Hyperskill" as a source—may have additional courses
3. **Extract duration systematically**: Develop better parsing for course length indicators
4. **Capture prerequisites**: Look for prerequisite information on individual course pages

**Strengths:**
- ✅ **Unique value proposition**: In-IDE learning is distinctive and valuable for developer education
- ✅ **High-quality content**: Strong focus on modern languages (Kotlin, Rust) and practical skills
- ✅ **Professional tooling**: Integration with industry-standard IDEs (PyCharm, IntelliJ, etc.)
- ✅ **Free content**: All courses currently free, suggesting potential licensing opportunity

**Considerations:**
- ⚠️ **Technical requirements**: In-IDE format may require special integration/compatibility
- ⚠️ **Smaller catalog**: 29 courses is modest compared to other providers
- ⚠️ **Developer-focused**: Very narrow audience (software developers only)
- ⚠️ **Competing platform**: JetBrains Academy is both partner and competitor

**Recommendation**:
**Explore partnership for specialized developer content**.
